comment.realname: lifeasdaddy ...a guy, his wife, and their son...
comment.author: 13267298@N00
comment._content: This monument stands in Sydney's Waverley Cemetery. Using the zoom feature at the Persisten URL enables many of the inscriptions to be read. Essentially, it is a monument to the Irish Insurrection of 1798 - however a monument which was initiated in Sydney during the centenary celebrations of 1898. Some of the background mentioning the remains therein interred, those of Michael Dwyer and Mrs. Dwyer are mentioned in this Sydney Morning Herald of Monday May 23, 1898: nla.gov.au/nla.news-article14135935 See a modern photo here: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/slainte/167612337/] and here: www.flickr.com/photos/slainte/sets/72157594177553857/with...
